title: Texas floods death toll climbs to more than 100, 11 still missing
byline: The death toll from flash floods that struck central Texas on Friday has now climbed to more than 100 people and an unknown number of others are missing.

title: Man involved in multiple crimes including murder arrested in Kalmunai
byline: An individual connected to a series of crimes, including murders, has been arrested by the Homicide and Organized Crime Investigation Unit of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the country today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today (08), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Trump to put 25% tariffs on Japan and South Korea, new import taxes on 12 other nations
byline: US President Donald Trump unveiled higher tariffs for Japan, South Korea and a dozen other countries in a push for new trade deals - but extended the deadline until August for the steeper levies to kick in.

title: Govt set to introduce property tax in 2027
byline: The government has agreed to introduce a nationwide property tax in the first half of 2027, according to the latest staff report issued by the IMF.

title: Abdul Wazeeth takes oath as SLMC National List MP
byline: Mohamed Sheriff Abthul Wazeeth was sworn in as a Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) National List Member of Parliament before the Speaker of the House, (Dr.) Jagath Wickramaratne, a short while ago.

title: Sri Lanka’s foreign reserve assets decline to USD 6.08 billion
byline: Sri Lanka’s official foreign reserve assets have decreased to US$ 6.08 billion in June 2025, according to the latest data released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Circular issued reducing mandatory retirement age of nurses to 60 years
byline: The Public Service United Nurses Union says that the reduction of the mandatory retirement age of nurses to 60 years may cause a number of problems in the future.

title: Texas floods death toll climbs to more than 100
byline: The death toll from flash floods that struck central Texas on Friday has now climbed to more than 100 people and an unknown number of others are missing.

title: SC rules against Police following FR filed by two farmers
byline: The Supreme Court has ruled that police had violated the fundamental human rights of two farmers after the duo was arrested and subsequently remanded over a protest staged in 2018 along the Polonnaruwa-Mahiyanganaya road.

title: Govt to recruit 5,000 to police service promptly
byline: The recruitment of 5,000 police personnel will take place promptly to fill the existing vacancies in the Police service, the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala said in Parliament.

title: Israel PM Netanyahu nominates Donald Trump for Nobel Peace Prize
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday told US President Donald Trump he had nominated him for the Nobel Peace Prize, handing Trump a nomination letter during a meeting at the White House.

title: All Sri Lankan citizens should be able to access services in their mother tongue – PM Harini
byline: National policies must be implemented in a way that every Sri Lankan citizen can access essential services in their respective mother tongues as well as in sign language, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has emphasised.

title: China extends visa-free entry to more than 70 countries to draw tourists
byline: Foreign tourists are trickling back to China after the country loosened its visa policy to unprecedented levels.

title: Fire breaks out at Karadiyana garbage dump in Piliyandala
byline: A fire has broken out at the Karadiyana garbage dump in Piliyandala.

title: Aamir Khan’s Sitaare Zameen Par surpasses his Taare Zameen Par at box office
byline: Aamir Khan’s “Sitaare Zameen Par” has taken the box office by storm and reached a diverse audience, earning a place among the highest-grossing films of 2025.

title: Ministry denies reports Govt procured high-priced electrical units for e-NIC Project
byline: The Ministry of Digital Economy has issued a clarification regarding misleading media reports on the procurement of power distribution units (PDUs) for computers and equipment systems at Divisional Secretariats under the Electronic National Identity Card (e-NIC) Project.

title: Harsha proposes two solutions to solve AliExpress-Temu budget shipping issue
byline: Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (COPF) and Member of Parliament Dr. Harsha de Silva has proposed two solutions to address the purported decision by AliExpress and Temu platforms to suspend several of its budget shipping options to Sri Lanka following the implementation of revised customs tax regulations.

title: Sri Lanka’s foreign reserve assets decline by 3.3%
byline: Sri Lanka’s official foreign reserve assets have decreased to US$ 6.08 billion in June 2025, according to the latest data released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Underwater turbine spinning for 6 years off Scotland’s coast is breakthrough for tidal energy
byline: Submerged in about 40 meters (44 yards) of water off Scotland’s coast, a turbine has been spinning for more than six years to harness the power of ocean tides for electricity — a durability mark that demonstrates the technology’s commercial viability.

title: Specialist neurosurgeon at J’pura Hospital further remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered that Dr. Maheshi Wijeratne, a consultant neurosurgeon attached to the Sri Jayewardenepura General Hospital, who was previously arrested and remanded by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), be further remanded until July 15.

title: Tourist arrivals in 2025 surpass 1.2 million, 250,000 from India
byline: A total of 1,204,046 tourists have arrived in Sri Lanka so far this year, marking a significant increase compared to the same period in 2024, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) stated.

title: Four including Ex-DMT Commissioner General granted bail
byline: Four persons, including former Commissioner General of Motor Traffic Nishantha Anuruddha Weerasinghe, have been granted bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Report on controversial release of shipping containers in Parliament promptly: Dy Minister
byline: The report of the committee appointed to investigate the allegations related to the controversial release of shipping containers will be presented to Parliament in the near future, Deputy Minister of Economic Development (Prof.) Anil Jayantha Fernando has said.

title: President vows to deliver justice to Easter attack victims, regardless of institutional challenges
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has affirmed that every possible step will be taken to ensure justice to the victims of the Easter Sunday attacks, without allowing the passage of time to obscure the truth.

title: Injured tusker ‘Bhathiya’ shows signs of improvement
byline: Treatment for the critically injured wild tusker ‘Bhathiya’ continued for a third day today (08), with veterinarians reporting that the elephant is showing some signs of activity.

title: Former Health Ministry Secretary Chandragupta granted bail
byline: Former Secretary to the Health Ministry, Janaka Chandragupta, who had been remanded following arrest by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) over allegations of unlawfully amassing over Rs. 35 million in assets, has been granted bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: New Commissioner General of Excise appointed
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the appointment of M.B.N.A. Pemarathne, a retired Commodore of the Sri Lanka Navy, to the post of Commissioner General of Excise.

title: Sri Lanka-Pakistan discuss ways to improve economic, educational, and political ties
byline: Sri Lanka and Pakistan have held discussions to improve social, economic, educational, and political ties between the two nations.

title: Harsha proposes solutions to solve AliExpress-Temu budget shipping issue
byline: Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (COPF) and Member of Parliament Dr. Harsha de Silva has proposed two solutions to address the purported decision by AliExpress and Temu platforms to suspend several of its budget shipping options to Sri Lanka following the implementation of revised customs tax regulations.

title: Committee to probe irregularities at Central Cultural Fund
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to appoint a three-member committee to investigate alleged malpractices at the Central Cultural Fund (CCF) during the period from 2017 to 2020.

title: First malaria treatment for babies approved for use
byline: The first malaria treatment suitable for babies and very young children has been approved for use.

title: Payment of monthly pension to farmers to resume from this month
byline: All necessary measures have been taken to resume paying monthly pensions to farmers who previously lost their pension, starting this month, the Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board has stated.

title: Deputy Commissioner of Inland Revenue remanded over bribery charge
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the remand of a Deputy Commissioner of the Inland Revenue Department, who was arrested on suspicion of accepting a bribe from a businessman to ensure the clearance of tax arrears amounting to nearly Rs. 1.1 million owed to the Inland Revenue Department (IRD).

title: Milan Bergamo Airport tragedy as person ‘sucked into plane engine’
byline: A person has died in a horrific incident at Milan Bergamo Airport after reportedly being pulled into an aircraft engine on a taxiway.

title: Govt. to provide annual allowance for religious school teachers
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to pay an annual allowance of Rs. 7,500, inclusive of both the teachers’ allowance and uniform allowance, to educators serving in registered religious schools affiliated with the Buddhist, Hindu, Islamic, Christian, and Catholic faiths.

title: Michael Douglas says he has no plans to act again
byline: Veteran actor Michael Douglas, a two-time Oscar winner who starred in classic movies like “Wall Street” and “Fatal Attraction,” says he has no plans to act again unless “something special came up.”

title: Cairo telecom building fire kills 4, disrupts internet and phone
byline: Four workers were killed and at least 22 others were injured in a fire that broke out on Monday at a key data centre in Cairo, Hossam Abdel Ghaffar, the spokesperson at Egypt’s Health Ministry, told Reuters on Tuesday.

title: Over 3,800 red notices issued during Mosquito Control Week
byline: A total of 144,250 premises have been inspected island-wide during the National Mosquito Control Week implemented last week, the Media Spokesperson of the National Dengue Control Unit of the Ministry of Health, Community Medical Specialist Dr. Prasheela Samaraweera, said.

title: President stresses urgent need to digitalise IRD to achieve 2030 digital economy targets
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (08) emphasised the critical need to strengthen and digitalise the Inland Revenue Department (IRD) to achieve Sri Lanka’s strategic digital economy objectives by 2030.

title: Cabinet nod for Sri Lanka Navy to conduct maritime security operations
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the proposal presented by the President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, for the Sri Lankan Navy (SLN) to conduct maritime security operations in relation to commercial ships, under the supervision of the Ministry of Defence.

title: King Charles hosts Macron in first European state visit since Brexit
byline: King Charles welcomed French President Emmanuel Macron to Britain on Tuesday for the first state visit by a European leader since Brexit, their warm greeting symbolising the return of closer ties between the two countries.

title: Sri Lanka among top 3 summer getaways, according to Emirates search data
byline: Sri Lanka is among the top three summer destinations for travel in July and August, according to the latest booking data of Emirates, the world’s biggest international airline.

title: Trump says US must send more weapons to Ukraine, days after ordering pause in deliveries
byline: President Donald Trump said Monday the U.S. will have to send more weapons to Ukraine, just days after ordering a pause in critical weapons deliveries to Kyiv.

title: ‘Army Upul’ murder suspect arrested with two SMG firearms in Ragama
byline: A suspect has been arrested in connection with the fatal shooting of a person in front of a residence in the Batuwatta area of Ragama on July 3rd, police said.

title: Tamil Nadu CM inaugurates 729 houses for Sri Lankan Tamils in five districts
byline: Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, MK Stalin on Monday inaugurated 729 houses built at a cost of Rs 38.76 crore for Sri Lankan Tamils living in Sri Lankan rehabilitation camps..
